cards.definition: A named container for storing data values. In JavaScript, you can declare variables using 'let', 'const', or 'var'.
A block of code designed to perform a particular task. Functions are executed when they are called (invoked).
A special variable that can hold more than one value at a time. Arrays are written with square brackets and elements are separated by commas.
A collection of properties, where each property is a key-value pair. Objects are written with curly braces {}.
The Document Object Model is a programming interface for HTML and XML documents. It represents the page so that programs can change the document structure, style, and content.
A procedure in JavaScript that waits for an event to occur, such as a user clicking a button or pressing a key.
JavaScript Object Notation is a lightweight data-interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write and easy for machines to parse and generate.
A function passed into another function as an argument, which is then invoked inside the outer function to complete some kind of routine or action.
A keyword that refers to the object it belongs to. The value of 'this' depends on how a function is called.
A feature in JavaScript where an inner function has access to the outer (enclosing) function's variables, even after the outer function has finished execution.
